sentence.text: Big-name Bordeaux reds of older vintage are very pricey at the giant Leclerc stores : compare the prices of Château Lagrange 1975 , about £17 , and Château Montrose 1982 , about £20 , to those charged by London merchants Bibendum -- £11.50 and £15.81 respectively .
Wild thing : pricey at £17 , but this hand-painted mug from Honiton Pottery is almost a work of art .
Brian approached a major manufacturer of garden pools and , while they were interested in principle , they felt that the unit would be too pricey for the end-user .
Despite the name , the Tattershall Park Country Club is n't a pricey place — admission is only £1 for adults and 50p for children .
American consumers have shown a disconcerting willingness to substitute sparkling wine for champagne , off-the-rack imitations for pricey designer clothes .
The industry , left with huge stocks after three excellent years , has succumbed to a financial malaise amid declining demand for its pricier brands .
Customers are thin on the ground at the group 's pricier outlets such as Cafe Pelican and the Leadenhall Wine Bar , but the Cafe Rouge is heaving .
Fantastic product , and very pricey payments .
It could be a joint development or a pricey investment by a third party .
Software written to ToolChest will be able to bypass pricey compliance testing on all the various Sparc boxes .
The sale 's priciest lot , another Renoir , ‘ Portrait of Jean Renoir ’ , sold within estimates at $2.31 million ( £1.26 million ) to a South American collector .

At the moment the stove runs on Coleman 's own fuel which is quite pricey .
At over £3,200 , with a mono VGA display , the Dan is impressive but pricey .
